alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:29PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Moore, Lincoln and northern Franklin Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 629 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Petersburg to 7 miles north of Hazel Green. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winchester, Fayetteville, Lynchburg, Decherd, Estill Springs, Petersburg, Tims Ford Lake, Lincoln, Howell and Hurdlow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
